greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of distinct prime divisors of n which are <= sqrt(n).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} prime(k) * x^(prime(k)^2) / (1 - x^prime(k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 04 2020
example: 2 and 3 are the distinct prime divisors of 12 and both 2 and 3 are <= square root of 12. So a(12) = 2 + 3 = 5.
maple: with(numtheory): a:=proc(n) local s,F,f,i: s:=0: F:=factorset(n): f:=nops(F): for i from 1 to f do if F[i]^2<=n then s:=s+F[i] else s:=s: fi od: s; end: seq(a(n),n=1..110); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 30 2006
mathematica: Table[DivisorSum[n, # &, And[PrimeQ@ #, # <= Sqrt[n]] &], {n, 103}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 04 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*isprime(d)*(d <= sqrt(n))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 17 2017
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Sep 07 2004
